title: Memorials of Edinburgh in the olden time
author: Wilson, Daniel
snippet: The house, although occupied towards the close of last century as the Sheriff-clerk's chambers, remained an entailed property in the possession of Clement Little's descendants, until its demolition, and the principal carved stones are now preserved in the garden at Inch House. According to the traditions of last century, as Creech informs us in his Fugitive Pieces," this interesting old mansion formed the residence of Cromwell during part of the time he resided in Edinburgh,2 possibly while engaged in the siege of the Castle.

title: Romance of War ... New edition
author: Grant, James
snippet: Evan next applied his shoulder to the shattered barrier, and burst it open. 'Maister Lisle o' the Inch House! Hurrah ! How happy I am to see you ! Od, this dings a' !' he exclaimed in breathless astonishment, as Lisle issued from his place of confinement. ' Ha, Louis !' cried Stuart, grasping his hand in wonder.
